item.title: How to Convert a SQL Table to C# Class
item.dc:creator: Sunny Sharma
item.description: Run the following SQL query and it will print the SQL table in a formatted C# Class: ———————————————————– DECLARE @tbl sysname = ‘doc360_User_Role’ DECLARE @ClassStr varchar(MAX) = ‘public class ‘ + @tbl + ‘ {‘ SELECT @ClassStr = @ClassStr + ‘ public ‘ + ColumnType + NullableSign + ‘ ‘ + ColumnName + ‘ { … Continue reading "How to Convert a SQL Table to C# Class"

item.title: Awarded – Microsoft MVP 2nd time in a row

item.description: Gladly sharing that I’m awarded Microsoft MVP 2nd time in a row. Thank you Microsoft for the recognition again. I want to extend my thanks to all my friends and whosoever has supported me along the way! Thank you. Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) award is given to “exceptional, independent community leaders who share their passion, technical … Continue reading "Awarded – Microsoft MVP 2nd time in a row"

item.title: [Powershell] Azure Automation – Delete all Azure Logic Apps in a Resource Group
item.dc:creator: Sunny Sharma
item.description: In one of my recent projects I had a requirement to delete all the Logic Apps from a resource group on Azure. In this quick blog I’m sharing how to delete all the logic apps in one go inside a resource group using the following Powershell script: Prerequisites: Service Principal Account Credentials (ClientId / Secret) SubscriptionId … Continue reading "[Powershell] Azure Automation – Delete all Azure Logic Apps in a Resource Group"

item.title: [Powershell] Export Self-Signed Certificate
item.dc:creator: Sunny Sharma
item.description: $cert = New-SelfSignedCertificate -DnsName yourdomain.cloudapp.net -CertStoreLocation “cert:\LocalMachine\My” $password = ConvertTo-SecureString -String “Password@1234” -Force -AsPlainText #Generate .pfx Export-PfxCertificate -Cert $cert -FilePath “.\my-cert-file.pfx” -Password $password #Export to .cer format Export-Certificate -Type CERT -Cert $cert -FilePath .\my-cert-file.cer

item.description: Today  I spent nearly 2 hours browsing through the Web for ways to create an SSL Certificate for Free from Let’s Encrypt. item.description: Even though you’re a Windows OS user for a very long time I’m sure you would love to know this!
